title: Chunky Serif With Gaps
content:
I'm trying to identify this typeface. Any help would be greatly appreciated. I'm also looking for similar serif typefaces that are missing strokes or have similar gaps within the characters.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415100537im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202013-01-29%20at%201_5474.34.38%20AM.png)
author: PPPDDDXXX

comments.content: Thank you very much. Do you, or anyone else, know of any similar typefaces?

Starting by having a look to [Typecache Font Cluster: Stencil Serif/Slab Serif Fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415100537/http:/typecache.com/font-clusters/06/) could be helpful.  
None of them are actually close. They share only "serif+stencil" specifications. Dala Floda is an original design and deserve its price.  
Anyway, here's a selection: [Caslon Fina Stencil](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415100537/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/applyinteractive/caslon-fina-stencil/), [Avia](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415100537/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/avia/), [Nadia](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415100537/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typeinnovations/nadia/), [Typonine Stencil Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415100537/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typonine/ty-stencil-pro/), [Q-Stencil](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415100537/http:/www.playtype.com/font/q-stencil), [Sensaway](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415100537/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/gestalten/sensaway_pro_heavy/), [Stencil Two](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415100537/http:/www.tendollarfonts.com/product/stencil-two-typeface), [DeVinne Stencil](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415100537/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/de-vinne-stencil/)
I agree that Floda is worth the price. It's a beautiful typeface, but I was just curious what else was out there. Thanks for your help.
List went into [list of lists](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415100537/http:/typophile.com/node/81517#comment-541346). Thanks, Ryuk.

[Nadia](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415100537/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typeinnovations/nadia/) is so similar to Dala Floda and Galliard that we’ve not included it in [the list](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415100537/http:/typecache.com/font-clusters/06/).
